    Duplication Matrix

    Ivan Jacob Agaloos Pesigan

    duplication-matrix.Rmd
    library(linearAlgebra)

    The duplication matrix \(\mathbf{D}_{m}\) is the \(m^2 \times \frac{m \left( m + 1 \right)}{2}\) matrix for a given \(m \times m\) symmetric matrix \(\mathbf{A}\) where \[\begin{equation} \mathbf{D}_{m} \mathrm{vech} \left( \mathbf{A} \right) = \mathrm{vec} \left( \mathbf{A} \right) . \end{equation}\]

    x <- matrix(
  data = c(
    1.0, 0.5, 0.4,
    0.5, 1.0, 0.6,
    0.4, 0.6, 1.0
  ),
  ncol = 3
)
m <- dim(x)[1]
dcap(m)
#>       [,1] [,2] [,3] [,4] [,5] [,6]
#>  [1,]    1    0    0    0    0    0
#>  [2,]    0    1    0    0    0    0
#>  [3,]    0    0    1    0    0    0
#>  [4,]    0    1    0    0    0    0
#>  [5,]    0    0    0    1    0    0
#>  [6,]    0    0    0    0    1    0
#>  [7,]    0    0    1    0    0    0
#>  [8,]    0    0    0    0    1    0
#>  [9,]    0    0    0    0    0    1
dcap(m) %*% vech(x)
#>       [,1]
#>  [1,]  1.0
#>  [2,]  0.5
#>  [3,]  0.4
#>  [4,]  0.5
#>  [5,]  1.0
#>  [6,]  0.6
#>  [7,]  0.4
#>  [8,]  0.6
#>  [9,]  1.0
all.equal(
  c(dcap(m) %*% vech(x)),
  vec(x)
)
#> [1] TRUE
